title: Upcoming Pay-Per-View Events from Comcast Xfinity On Demand
text: Utah Comcast Examiner As a Senior Director of Public Relations for Comcast, Ray Child is responsible for the company’s news media relations, community relations and employee communications in Utah and Arizona. Ray’s responsibilities include leading the local development of company initiatives including Comcast Cares Day, an annual day of volunteerism in which Comcast employees, their families and community volunteers join in a day of service to benefit organizations and people in need. In 2014, nearly 9,000 volunteers participated in Comcast Cares Day in Utah and Arizona. He manages Comcast’s support of the United Way through employee giving campaigns and company participation in the LIVE UNITED campaign. Comcast was named the Outstanding Corporate Partner by the United Way of Salt Lake in 2012. Ray has also created public relations strategies to successfully launch numerous products and services in Utah and Arizona. Prior to joining Comcast, Ray held management positions with companies in the telecommunications industry. He developed a public relations strategy to announce a company sponsorship of the 2002 Olympic Winter Games in Salt Lake City, which resulted in the company’s most widely covered news media event. He also created and implemented a communications strategy that helped a company win the Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award. Ray graduated from the University of Utah with a bachelor’s degree in Speech Communications.
